intro: Cousinia schischkinii, commonly known as the Schischkin's cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, thriving in rocky or sandy soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cousinia schischkinii is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
